meanings.definition: A bitter herb eaten at the Passover Seder.
meanings.sent1: During the Seder, we taste the maror to remember the bitterness of slavery.
meanings.sent2: The maror added a sharp taste to the meal.
meanings.sent3: The maror seemed to challenge our taste buds with its bitterness.
meanings.sent4: The maror was like a wake-up call for our senses, jolting us with its sharp flavor.
meanings.sent5: The maror left a lingering bitterness in my mouth, a reminder of the past.

meanings.sent1: She could not help but maror at the unfair treatment she received.
meanings.sent2: He marored silently, unable to let go of the hurt.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was just a game, he couldn't help but maror at losing.
meanings.sent4: Her heart marored with resentment towards those who had wronged her.
meanings.sent5: The bitterness of his words made her maror at the thought of reconciliation.
